action_title: Use prescribed fire or modifications to burning regime in grassland
key_messages:
Key Messages:

Two studies (including one before-and-after, site comparison study) in the USA and Argentina found that annual prescribed fires in grassland decreased numbers of amphibian species and abundanceÂ or, along with changes in grazing regime, increased rates of species loss.
One replicated, before-and-after study in the USA found that spring, but not autumn or winter burns, decreased salamander abundance.
